Method Detail

getStat

Stat getStat(java.lang.String name)
Gets a Stat specified by its name.

Parameters:
name - The name of the stat.
Returns:
The Stat.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if you want to add more then 10 stat items.

resetStat

void resetStat(java.lang.String name)
Resets a Stat of the Player specified by its name

Parameters:
name - The name of the stat.

hasStat

boolean hasStat(java.lang.String name)
Checks if the Stat already exists.

Parameters:
name - The name of the stat.
Returns:
If the Stat exists.

getDisplayName

java.lang.String getDisplayName()
Gets the Display Name of the Stat. The Display Name is shown as a 'Label' or Title for all following stats.

Returns:
The Display Name of the Stat.

setDisplayName

void setDisplayName(java.lang.String displayName)
Sets the Display Name of the Stat. The Display Name is shown as a 'Label' or Title for all following stats.
Maximum length for the Display Name is 32 characters.

Parameters:
displayName - The new Display Name.

sendImage

void sendImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
Sends an Image to the Mod User. The Image will be sent as Base64 encoded String.

Parameters:
image - The BufferedImage that should be sent.

sendImage

void sendImage(java.lang.String path)
Sends an Image to the Mod User. The Image will be sent as Base64 encoded String.

Parameters:
path - The Path where the image is located (in your bukkit server directory).

resetImage

void resetImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
Removes the Image from the Mod User. The Image itself should have been sent already.

Parameters:
image - The BufferedImage that should be removed.

resetImage

void resetImage(java.lang.String path)
Removes the Image from the Mod User. The Image itself should have been sent already.

Parameters:
path - The Path where the image is located (in your bukkit server directory).

clearStats

void clearStats()
Clears all stats.
